prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to rephrase this text without modifying its meaning. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
The baby suffered a cardiac arrest at the theme park on Thursday

A woman has been arrested on suspicion of neglecting a five-month-old boy who suffered a cardiac arrest at a theme park.

The baby is in a critical condition in hospital following the incident at Legoland Windsor at about 13:00 BST on Thursday, police said.

A 27-year-old woman from Witham, Essex, was arrested on suspicion of neglecting a child to cause unnecessary injury.

She has been released on bail until 26 July.

Det Con Zoe Eele, of Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit, said: "Firstly, our thoughts are with the family of the boy who is in a critical condition in hospital after suffering a cardiac arrest.

"We are working closely with the team at Legoland Windsor Resort but would like to speak to anyone who have information about this incident, specifically anyone who was queueing for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between around 11.30am and 12:45pm.

"I would ask for the public to please avoid speculation about the incident and to respect the boy's family at this deeply upsetting time."

Police said they are not looking for further suspects in relation to the incident.

In a statement, the theme park said: "On Thursday, a young guest was taken ill... and our fully trained First Aid team administered immediate care until the emergency services arrived.

"We will continue to support Thames Valley Police with their ongoing investigation."

Follow BBC South on Facebook, X, or Instagram. Send your story ideas to south.newsonline@bbc.co.uk or via WhatsApp on 0808 100 2240.

The BBC is not responsible for the content of external sites.
stories:
At the theme park on Thursday, a five-month-old baby experienced a cardiac arrest. A woman, aged 27, from Witham, Essex, has been taken into custody on charges of neglect resulting in serious injury. The infant is currently in critical condition at the hospital. The woman has been granted bail until July 26.

Detective Constable Zoe Eele of Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit expressed, "Our thoughts go out to the family of the boy, who is critically ill in the hospital following a cardiac arrest. We are collaborating with Legoland Windsor Resort. Witnesses who queued for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between approximately 11:30 am and 12:45 pm are encouraged to contact us with any relevant information. Please refrain from spreading rumors about the incident and respect the family's privacy during this emotional time."

Thames Valley Police does not seek any additional suspects regarding the incident.

In a release, Legoland Windsor stated, "On Thursday, a visitor fell ill... Our well-equipped First Aid team provided instant attention until the emergency responders arrived. We will continue to cooperate with Thames Valley Police in their investigation."

Join BBC South on Facebook, X, or Instagram. Send your story suggestions to south.newsonline@bbc.co.uk or via WhatsApp on 0808 100 2240.

The BBC is not liable for the content of external websites.

At the theme park on Thursday, a five-month-old baby suffered a cardiac arrest. A 27-year-old woman from Witham, Essex, has been arrested and charged with neglect leading to serious injury. The baby is presently in critical condition at the hospital. The woman has been released on bail until July 26.

Detective Constable Zoe Eele of Thames Valley Police's Child Abuse Investigation Unit stated, "Our sympathies are with the family of the baby boy, who is critically ill in the hospital due to a cardiac arrest. We are working with Legoland Windsor Resort. Individuals who waited in line for the Coastguard HQ boat ride between around 11:30 am and 12:45 pm and may have relevant information are urged to contact us. Please avoid spreading unfounded rumors concerning the incident and respect the family's privacy during this trying time."

Thames Valley Police have no further suspects in relation to the incident.

In a statement, Legoland Windsor reported, "On Thursday, a guest took ill... Our well-prepared First Aid team administered immediate care until the emergency services arrived. We remain committed to collaborating with Thames Valley Police in their investigation."

A five-month-old baby boy suffered a cardiac arrest at a theme park on Thursday. The Thames Valley Police are investigating potential negligence by a 27-year-old woman from Witham, Essex, in connection with the baby's serious injuries. Her trial is set for July 26.

Authorities and theme park administrators are working together on the investigation. Anyone with relevant information between 11:30 am and 12:45 pm is asked to contact the authorities. The public is requested to avoid spreading unsubstantiated information about the incident and to respect the privacy of the affected family during this difficult period.

At present, no other suspects have been identified by the Thames Valley Police in this case.

For suggestions on article pitches, please contact BBC South through Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, email (south.newsonline@bbc.co.uk), or phone (0808 100 2240) using WhatsApp.

BBC does not support the content of external websites.
